title: The Future Fund sees senior departure in unlisted property
text:
The Future Fund has lost one of its senior investors in its unlisted property team.

It is understood Sally Box has left the Future Fund, only a few months after she joined as a director, unlisted property, and reporting to head of unlisted property Stewart Tillyard.

Box arrived at the Future Fund having previously worked in investment banking at Greenhill Australia and Evercore.

The Future Fund chief investment officer Raphael Arndt has $11.04 billion invested in property as at September 30.

Box told Street Talk she left the Future Fund on "good terms", and that she had "other more entrepreneurial options" that she wanted to pursue.

It comes as Tillyard – who was promoted to the newly created role of unlisted property in mid-2018 – has also been absent from the office. It is believed questions had been raised about Tillyard's management style with sources suggesting he had taken a period of forced leave.

A Future Fund spokesman told this column Tillyard was still with the Future Fund and confirmed he was on leave. The spokesman declined to comment on the nature of Tillyard's leave.

The Future Fund had $11.04 billion invested in property as at September 30, which accounted 6.7 per cent of its assets.
description: The Future Fund has lost one of its senior investors in its unlisted property team.
